The Chaos Elemental is a dark cloud with six tentacles that dwells in the members-only section of the Wilderness, just west of the Rogues' Castle. This area is moderately easy to access from the deep Wilderness teleport lever in Ardougne or Edgeville. A Wilderness Obelisk can randomly teleport players south-east of the Rogues' Castle.

The Chaos Elemental is generally killed for its dragon 2h sword and pickaxe drops. It also has a higher drop rate of the pet chaos elemental compared to the Chaos Fanatic. In addition, it is immune to venom—any items that are able to inflict venom will inflict regular poison instead.

Warning: As this boss is located deep within the Wilderness, and wanders around in a multi-combat zone, beware of player-killers! Do not bring items you are not willing to lose.

Killing the Chaos Elemental is a requirement for the Hard Wilderness Diary.

Location[edit | edit source]

Location Levels Members Spawns Map
West of the Rogues' Castle3051Maplink

Attacks[edit | edit source]

Discord Madness Confusion
Deals Melee, Ranged or Magic damage Unequips up to four worn items Teleports the target somewhere nearby

The Chaos Elemental has three attacks. Its primary attack is a projectile attack that resembles series of three different colours fired at the target. This attack can deal either Magic, Ranged, or Melee damage — it is impossible to distinguish what damage is dealt. The projectiles hit into the 20s, but it is still suggested that players utilise Protect from Magic to reduce the chance of being hit, as the projectile deals magic damage most frequently.

A group of players take on the Chaos Elemental.

It also has two special attacks. The first one teleports players a short space or several spaces away from it. The second attack unequips up to four items that players are wielding, forcing them to take time to re-equip their armour and weapons before continuing the battle. Like most monsters, its attacks will continue to follow the player until impact and can travel through walls. The weapon of the player is always prioritised, so when this attack is successful, the player will always have to re-equip their weapon.

However, if a player was to bring food such as curry to the Chaos Elemental, it will not be able to unequip the players items, because when you eat curry, the bowl will remain in the players inventory, giving the Chaos Elemental no room to remove your items. Another strategy to prevent this attack from being launched is to bring a sack (or basket) of potatoes, cabbages, onions, etc. Whenever you need to eat, simply empty the sack or basket after each bite. With practice this can be done quite quickly without interrupting your attacks.

This does, however, give the Chaos Elemental a chance to use a teleportation or offensive attack in turn, so you could leave just a single empty spot in your inventory for the Chaos Elemental to unequip one of your items instead of up to four. With enough practice this can save some supplies in the long run, since the unequipping attack does not deal any damage and replaces a potentially high-hitting offensive spell.

Drops[edit | edit source]

The following drop rates are provided by Jagex, unless otherwise specified.

The average Chaos Elemental kill is worth 31,292.82.

The average Chaos Elemental kill while on a Konar task is worth 33,247.2.

Combat Achievements[edit | edit source]

The following Combat Achievement tasks involve the Chaos Elemental.

Name Description Difficulty Category
Chaos Elemental Adept Kill the Chaos Elemental 10 times. Hard Kill count
Hoarder Kill the Chaos Elemental without it unequipping any of your items. Hard Mechanical
The Flincher Kill the Chaos Elemental without taking any damage from it's[sic] attacks. Hard Perfection
Chaos Elemental Veteran Kill the Chaos Elemental 25 times. Elite Kill count

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
1 August 2019
(update | poll)

The respawn time of the Chaos Elemental has been decreased from 150 seconds to 60 seconds.

8 February 2018
(update | poll)

The Chaos elemental now uses its teleport attack less frequently than before.

5 March 2015
(update | poll)

The Chaos Elemental now drops dragon bones and babydragon bones as notes if you have completed the Wilderness Elite Diary.

6 February 2014
(update | poll)

The Kalphite Queen, King Black Dragon, the Chaos Elemental and the Dagannoth Kings now notify all nearby players of the loot they're dropping.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • The names of the Chaos Elemental's three attacks (Discord, Madness and Confusion) have never been officially stated by Jagex, but are named as such by the accompanying sound effects in the cache.
  • Lethe Napier Flem, a name used by the Chaos Elemental in issue 25 of Postbag from the Hedge[1], is an anagram of The Fallen Empire.

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ↑ Jagex. Postbag 25 - "Transcript:The original colour of the Barrows Brothers armour", 9, by Chaos Elemental. Old School RuneScape Postbags from the Hedge.
